answers.answer: Web MD has a good article on Hyperhidrosis that might be helpful for you. It is disappointing that doctors have dismissed you as there are indeed a few medical conditions that can cause it.  (Although in many people, it's just the way they are wired.)http://www.webmd.com/healthy-beauty/features/is-your-excessive-sweating-caused-by-a-medical-problemThe conditions they list areMenopausePregnancyThyroid problemsDiabetesAlcoholismInfectious diseases like tuberculosisParkinson's diseaseRheumatoid arthritisStrokeHeart failureCancers like leukemia and lymphoma

question: I am well past my post-menapausal years.  So I know the excessive sweating that I am having is not related to this.  But the sweating has taken over my life.  I can't get ready in the mornings because the hair dryer is not able to dry my hair sufficiently because it's always pouring water.  Can't put on makeup because watering pouring down my face.  It effects my whole head, neck, back and crotch.  And not unusual for me to change clothes many times a day and during the night.  Does anybody know what this is?  Why it happens?  and How to treat it?  Oh yes, I have been to doctors who look at you like you are crazy and and ignore you.  Please I am so tired of living this way.  Can someone help me?
title: How can I get help?
